definitions.definition: To agree , verify or concur ; to answer positively .
examples: She affirmed that she would go when I asked her.

definitions.definition: To assert positively; to tell with confidence; to aver ; to maintain as true.

examples: They did everything they could to affirm the children's self-confidence.

definitions.definition: To make firm; to confirm , or ratify ; especially ( law ) to assert or confirm, as a judgment, decree, or order, brought before an appellate court for review.

To state under a solemn promise to tell the truth which is considered legally equivalent to an oath , especially of those who have religious or other moral objections to swearing oaths; also solemnly affirm .
